title: Streaming service subscribers in India 2017
summary: This bar chart has 6 columns on the x axis representing Video-on-demand Service, and Number of subscribers in millions in each Video-on-demand Service on the y axis.
Video-on-demand Service Hotstar has the highest Number of subscribers in millions and Ozee TV has the lowest Number of subscribers in millions.
The highest Video-on-demand Service Hotstar has 60.6 more Number of subscribers in millions than the lowest Video-on-demand Service Ozee TV.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Video-on-demand Service in the x axis and Number of subscribers in millions in the y axis.
The Number of subscribers in millions is appeared to be the highest at Video-on-demand Service Hotstar and lowest at Video-on-demand Service Ozee TV.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 6 columns on the x axis representing Video-on-demand Service, and Number of subscribers in millions in each Video-on-demand Service on the y axis.
Video-on-demand Service Hotstar has the highest Number of subscribers in millions and Ozee TV has the lowest Number of subscribers in millions.
The highest Video-on-demand Service Hotstar has 60.6 more Number of subscribers in millions than the lowest Video-on-demand Service Ozee TV.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of subscribers in millions for 6 number of Video-on-demand Services.
Video-on-demand Service Hotstar has the highest Number of subscribers in millions and Ozee TV has the lowest Number of subscribers in millions.
The highest Video-on-demand Service Hotstar has 60.6 more Number of subscribers in millions than the lowest Video-on-demand Service Ozee TV.
The Video-on-demand Service Hotstar has the highest Number of subscribers in millions, followed by Voot, and Amazon Video. Down to the Video-on-demand Service Ozee TV which is the lowest.
The Video-on-demand Service Hotstar has 3.9 times more Number of subscribers in millions than average.
